Content: [dscrd-hush] <Akira X> But my mining rewards for months was like 15 a day

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Akira X> Those Asics are on fire

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> difficulty is very different right now

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> many pools are on the old chain, and paying out to miners on the old chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and so the people on the new chain are reaping extra rewards

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Akira X> And on Asics?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> some asics may be pointed at the old chain too

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but whoever is mining on the new chain, is earning more than they were before the new chain. because much lower difficulty, each person has higher % of network hashrate, nethash

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it gets complex, but that is the high level

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> less competition = more rewards per miner

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Akira X> I was talking to the trolls

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> oh right, the trolls

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I see Hush as a store-of-privacy, since 1 HUSH can be used to send thousands of secure private messages and also as a currency, because every message can also have financial value attached. That is the vision of Hush, to be the best store-of-privacy. The idea of storing future potential privacy in a private key, I find it fascinating and essential for the world we live in and much more so in the future that is coming.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and in our community we call these messages "memos" because they are powered by the Zcash protocol memo field, saved from the fires by the hands of radix42

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this zombie developer of a ded coin just wrote a :carlos:  || 28147 line airdrop bash script || :carlos: , how about that for trolling?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the details which trolls should totally not read are at || https://github.com/MyHush/hush3/commit/7e5fd654a3f90daa2afbcb21a0b14a19c8fc5d3f ||

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> also the meaning of life is ||                                                                   42                                    ||

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> A 2MB bash script, I am not sure if I have made such a unique creature before, it's a beautiful script that will migrate funds for ~31,000 addresses!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Doing something like this is not something to be rushed, or make mistakes, so I hope the community can appreciate that I am doing it as fast as I can, with taking all proper precautions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Akira X> Radix is your friend?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <tedy> @dukeleto checking your airdrop bash script it looks like immature blocks were not paid out to new chain. was that intentional?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @tedy what exactly do you mean by "immature blocks", do you mean "transactions in the mempool" i.e. "transactions with 0 confirmations" ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <tedy> No

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> The snapshot is calculated from the output of the `getsnapshot` RPC command, and it only looks at things with at least 1 confirmation, transactions that are inside a block. The mempool is dropped, in any snapshot/airdrop, because it's not part of blockchain history yet

Author: Gateway#3763
